title: Engaging, but lacking in substance
content: From the very beginning, this movie sets out to engage the audience and confront people with philosophical questions about time, and life. While I do like this approach, I cannot praise it too much because it sacrifices the story's coherence for a lot of drama that slows the film down. It is necessary to the story though, but I think the problem lies in the way the script is build up.Of course, this is still a matter of opinion, but to me whenever the movie got into the whole "multiple decisions in life" I thought it was very refreshing and interesting. But when the movie gets into the multiple lovers and marriages it slows down and the movie gets downright boring in some parts. Let me just clarify that I don't have anything against 'slow-paced' movies, or movies that don't focus as much on action, as long as it stays interesting or (in this case) thought-provoking. I told my friend who was watching it with me that it feels like it was directed by multiple people.As I said, I do like the concept this movie was going for. I just hope that in the future, a movie gets to marry interesting theoretical possibility's with a coherent script a little better. Because of the somewhat fragmented result, the movie seems a bit too pretentious and overall too pleased with itself.I'm somewhat hesitant to recommend Mr Nobody. Even though its definitely engaging, I don't think this movie will obviously appeal to everybody. Especially not to people who aren't into pseudo-scientific speculation. But if you're open to these sort of things and similar artistic efforts, you will praise this as much as anybody else.

title: Wasted 2.5 hours on this mess pretending to be "mind bending"
content: This was a long, tedious, boring mess which I guess can be called a movie. Heard so much about it and people even compared it to Inception. I can't believe I wasted 2.5 hours on this. Usually at the end of "mind bending" movies you ask yourself questions and try to make sense of it, but not with this one. You are relieved it ended and at the same time curse yourself for watching this bs.

title: Love is all we've got.
content: I travel a lot, and have "Mr Nobody" always with me on my laptop. I watch it at every opportunity I get. I like to pad time with this film. I have lost count of how many times I've seen it.In hotel rooms after strolling around in strange cities.In endless train rides, next to people reading their newspaper.And in airplanes while flying over the continents.I sometimes watch just the swimming pool scene.Or the "I wish time would stop now" scene.Other times I just listen to the theme song on repeat.Our precious love will destroy the world.

title: A near masterpiece
content: My friends randomly told me to watch this movie, and I was expecting something decent. What I saw quite nearly blew me away. I'm probably going to view it again. Very few times have I finished a movie, and have still been thinking about it hours later. Cloud atlas is the only other one that comes to mind. I thought cloud atlas was a masterpiece though, while this goes down as simply amazing. My only real gripes are a few minor continuity errors, mainly the fact that people's accents seemed to change for no reason sometimes, and there were a few ways that I think the story could have been told in a slightly more coherent fashion. And furthermore, one of the realities didn't really make sense to me. I'm sure some of my complaints were intentionally put there because I think the viewer is supposed to be lost throughout this whole movie to some degree. Aside from this though, it was perfect. This movie had some amazing directing and was visually stunning to say the least. One thing I can't understand though is why this movie wasn't known to me until a few days ago.

title: My first review. Loved the movie!
content: I googled "movies that make you think". I didn't even read the review, just decided to watch it. I have actually stopped the movie during the first 20 minutes, simply because I couldn't understand a f*cking thing. But believe me, it is so worth it! Makes your mind stop for a second, and think. I am glad I haven't read any reviews or summaries before the movie. I was getting it as it progressed.Sadly enough there are not many movies like this one. I love movies that make you review your life. My favorite ones is Veronica decided to die and Jeff who lives at home and Mr. Nobody now.Watch!

title: Boyhood on Crack; Mr. Nobody
content: This film is Boyhood on Crack and with an enormous helping of quantum physics and algorithms thrown in just for good measure. It is either one of the greatest films of all time, or (if you judge the box office which is lower than any film in history except Heaven's Gate), one of the worst films of all time. The likely truth is that it is somewhere in the middle, so I gave it a 6 (one extra star for originality). The visuals are quite stunning and reminiscent of 2001: A Space Odyssey. The emotional content is similar to Boyhood, and the sensual aspect of the perfect brother and sister twins is not related to any film I know of. This film is different, if nothing else. I guarantee you that you have seen nothing like it before. I can see why it didn't make any money. Most people are too ignorant to understand what the film is about; don't understand quantum physics and algorithms, and have difficulty in making a leap in imagination. Too bad for them.

title: Absolute Mindblow!
content: It is a goddamn head confusing movie.It did hurt my brain while I'm watching it.The movie explains to us how many differences and obstacles could be in our lives.You can't predict it.You can't know unless it happens.You have to make a choice to move on.And you have to move on...But our ends will be one.Whatever we choose , we can't change it.It is worth to spend some couple of hours for think over it.And at the space between two scenes must have some little effects or add some little more time,otherwise it can be a pain in the sweet heaven's ass.Actors and Actresses are splendid , talented and well chosen.The story is holy wicked.Absolutely blew my mind away from goddamn Milky Way.Actually it is not 'a' story..It's kind of couple of stories getting mixed up professionally.I Loved the movie.Thanks.. 8 out of 10

title: One Of My Favorite Films of All Time
content: Everything about this film amounts to perfection; this is where film making and art start to blend together. The amount of artistic value in this movie is staggering. Special and visual effects are gorgeous, making excellent use of their simplicity. The cinematography... Where do I even start? It's absolutely phenomenal in every sense of the word. Some of the shots are so inventive and smart my jaw was (unknowingly) hanging open at times.Set design is excellent as is the sound design. Editing is a work of wonder. The film is so perfectly paced that it never gets boring and constantly keeps your attention. This is of course possible due not only to the editing but also the direction and use of a nonlinear plot. Direction is masterful. Jaco Van Dormael uses every resource at his disposal to the maximum and has an eye for the smallest of smallest of details, right down to the colors certain characters wear (he does this in a very specific manner).Pierre Van Dormael composed one of the best soundtracks of all time for Mr. Nobody. His use of simple string instruments bring an emotional touch but it allows the film to breathe. There's also a wide selection of different songs used throughout the movie and it's all perfectly used. I don't normally like when unoriginal music is used in movies but when it's done with the precision and care that it was here it works out extremely well.Every character is cast perfectly and each give incredible performances. Jared Leto, Juno Temple, and Toby Regbo are the standouts here. Each of their performances were breathtaking. Again, I don't usually enjoy having child actors in movies because they normally can't hold up to their adult co-starts but, once again, in Mr. Nobody it's different. I really hope Toby Regbo finds more work; he deserves it.Lastly, the story. I already mentioned how the nonlinear plot is used excellently and keeps the film moving. The only time nonlinear films have worked so well were in Christopher Nolan's "Memento" and "The Prestige".The story is written by Van Dormael with such care and attention it's astonishing. I first saw the film a few months before this review and as of this writing I still think about it nearly everyday. The amount of times I was able to relate to the main characters was something special. This is a very human film with a very human core. Sure, it asks questions about reality and time and space but really it's about the people and how they progress as the story moves on.The film deals with a lot of heavy topics, some even controversial to certain religions (Christian among many others). This movie makes you think. It asks you questions and you, in turn, naturally start to debate them in your head as you watch. The film does an excellent job of keeping its viewers engaged in the story.This isn't a film for everyone (hence the 7.9 rating with only 92000 votes). This is a very intellectual, philosophical, and emotional story. I think some could relate it to "Inception" because it deals with some similar themes that question reality and just the fact that it can be so incredibly confusing!The way I perceived myself and reality changed after I watched this movie. Give this film a chance (it's even on Netflix). It amazes me how few people have actually seen this film. Even the late Roger Ebert never posted a review.This is one of those hidden movie gems. It isn't any one genre for it spans all the way from science fiction to modern day drama to romance. It's impossible to describe to someone for a reason. Overall, it's a very refreshing take on film in this age of Transformers sequels and Avengers mash-ups. It's probably one of the most original and unique movies ever made.

title: Exceptional movie from and exceptional director
content: How could I have missed this?Jaco Van Dormeal is an artist!You really need to see his 2 previous films, but this is a review of "Mr.Nobody".This is a remarkable film. It is Science Fiction (And the special effects are VERY good). It is a romance. It's hard to label it any one thing.Put down your ipad, put away your phone and WATCH this movie. If you don't you will miss something. There are few wasted shots, few unnecessary lines. And yes, it's VERY hard to follow. There are three major story lines, but each has their own branches.Jato Leto is fabulous. This was done just before he was nominated for an Oscar in "Dallas Buyer's Club", and you can see why he took a break between these two films. He is so many characters and yet remains the same.The movie I saw was the standard release on Netflix. I understand the Director's cut is the only one you should watch, so go get the blu-ray so you can get a better understanding of the story Mr. Dormeal intended to tell.One other note. The music is very nice, appropriate, and memorable. This is the last movie in which the director's brother, Pierre, contributed before his untimely death. As in the two previous efforts, it helps set the stage.This one is worth the effort. I can not recommend it enough.

title: Big-budget existentialist fantasy
content: Not sure how the brilliant, quirky Belgium director Jaco Van Dormael wound up making a big-budget American movie, but it's great he did. The film follows the title character through multiple life choices, although whether these are what has happened or what could have happened is not made clear until (sort of) at the end. I really didn't expect any decent explanation, but I kind of like what they did, even though I can't say it's that persuasive if you think about it.The movie is absolutely fascinating, full of vivid and extraordinary moments. The cast is excellent and the twisty story is well paced and thoroughly engrossing.Note that while Mr. Nobody's lives are strikingly different (perhaps more so than they should be, if we look at twin studies that suggest people with the same DNA make weirdly similar choices), they all involved his hooking up with super hot women. Whatever choices you make in your life, if you look like Jared Leto you'll have some commonalities.Highly recommended.

title: A surreal tread through nonlinearity
content: The story just don't get enough justice to be called a story, due to it serving multiple possibilities of Mr. Nobody's life. Those who get comfortable with this kind of surrealism are those who also get comfy with Darren Aronofsky's story telling and visualizations. Yet the movie offered something different from Aronofsky by presenting somewhat rather patchy editing and transitions, which actually turn out to be great due to them helping set the movie's pace to be really fast and tight at all times. Then again, I must say that this kind of movie can only be fully enjoyed by those who are experienced in understanding and thus enjoying complicated movies such as Nolans', or those who simply let go of any assumptions and expectations and then just absorbs all to then deconstruct it after watching. The acting feels very nice, especially in Jared Leto's work, being total and encompassing a wide breadth of character variations.

title: One of THE best movies i have ever seen!
content: OK, so this is one of THE best movies i have ever seen.It will get you right into it with some questions you want answers to and you wonder why, why did that just happened? And where did that come from?You will get confused and you will smile sometimes and that is what i like in a movie, when it gets you wondering: What's next?I am going to recommend this movie to a lot of people and i will tell them to watch it at least 2 times because i will and that is the beauty of a movie when you can see it many times and still find it interesting and fun!

title: Puzzled, confused, perhaps amused.
content: There is a girl i know who is very nice; I like to look at her.However if she asks me to come to my house, and then she leaves later in the night, i feel confused, hurt. Why does she make me believe that something nicer is going to happen ? Am i really just content of staring at her for two hours, without anything really happening?Of course you might have figured out the metaphor by now.Mr.Nobody is a .. strange film. Strage by your most Seventh Seal-ish, obscure Svedish film standards; We are introduced to a mr. Nemo, the protagonist who, during certain stages of his life, refuses to choose when choices are necessary, and to the result that his life is fragmented into many universes, many parallel possibilities, the one where he left his girlfriend and the one where he didn't, the one where he lived with his mum and the one where he lived with his dad. In an incessant obscure-hit singles filled soundtrack, withing the first half hour we are thrown between a dozen alternate realities, some where he is a boy, some who are in a far off future.In a series of apparently unjoined scenes, we are told a story of .. no wait; In a series of obviously joined scenes, we aren't really told anything because there is no framework into which to play a story.Seriously .. Film 101 . You guys didn't even go to college. don't write movies. There is no discernible (keyword) plot until the very end, except for the multiple universes thing; yeah, we got that. that was the introduction. Jared Leto doesn't take charge of his(well.. non-existent)character until the last few scenes, and considering that the average scene in this film lasts under 60 seconds, you'll have a lot of head scratching to do if you want to walk out the theatre and pretend you understood any of it.Of course the audio is perfect, the scenery, costumes, photography, everything is top notch. But if i wanted a mindf**k i would just randomly surf YouTube videos, since this film , To Me, makes about as sense as the "This IS SPARTAAA" remix video. with kitteh.Great film to watch for the hundredth time, on late night TV, when you are not really into watching film, but a total waste of time for anyone looking for content. An orgy of superficialness.6/10 and i'm being generous, it deserves a five.

title: One of the best movies out there!
content: I just saw this movie, and honestly I'm blown away. I can't comprehend how anyone could put such a complicated philosophy into a movie, without a traditional plot, and STILL make it somewhat understandable. It was confusing in many aspects, but I felt like I was able to follow along despite that. It was so cool to see all the different possible lives Nemo could have lived...made me think about how that would work with my own life. If you haven't seen this movie YOU HAVE TO. (I know I'm gong to beg all my friends to see it.) Just...watch it, even if it seems confusing, you'll grasp onto it very quickly. (Even I did, and I suck at following movie plots)P.S. Jared Leto is really good in this, probably his best work

title: Mind boggling, but senseless
content: I won't spoil it for you, I'll just say that it is good to be a decisive person, however, you are faced with a world where there is too much to choose from. Things are really meant to be simpler, and we are actually family oriented by nature. You cannot compare a human being to a caveman, because we have evolved far from that. If people started growing up in the wild today, they wouldn't behave anything like cavemen, although I can promise you, that we would go back to our family oriented and community style traits. Those who couldn't comply with it would see their ends one way or another, but all in all, you are more like an Amish person than you realize. Even more so than the Amish. Time itself and the universe are not set to a path of destruction, they were set that way when we started to fight who we are. If man wants to continue to evolve, he needs to get his heart in order first. That feeling you get in the spring time when wondering free in a field of wild flowers isn't to be taken for granted. You just don't get as much of it as you are supposed to because everything grew too fast and too complicated for us to realize who we are and what is best for us to be.

title: Pretentious
content: There are basically two types of art fans. There are those who love art because of the way it makes them feel. It can be a painting of a beautiful landscape, or a series of random colors on a canvas, but they love the feeling they get - the memories or dreams that are envoked - when they look at it. The art can be disturbing, but the emotion it envokes might still be a good one, such as overcoming a personal fear.The second type of art fan loves art for art's sake. A piece of art that does not evoke emotion is not quality art. It doesn't matter if that emotion is anger, resentment, fear, love, compassion, devotion, etc. As long as the art moves the viewer in some way, it is art. It doesn't matter if the art is ugly and repulsive.Those that gave the movie a good rating are art lovers of the second type. I am an art lover of the first type.This script makes no sense. Even for a sci-fi/fantasy movie, it makes no sense. It is not deep. It does not make you think. It's stupid.Oh, the people who love movies will say, "You just don't 'get' it. It's over your head. You're too dense to understand quality art" Whatever. I don't have to prove anything to them.If you're a movie fan that likes a good story that engages you, enwraps you, then makes you feel good at the end, this movie is not for you.If you're more concerned about impressing a professor of filmmaking at SUNY or UCLA than admitting you really did like The Notebook, then this movie is for you.

title: This is literally the best movie i have ever seen
content: This movie is easily the best movie I have ever seen. I cannot even begin to describe all of its layers which all blended together make, in my opinion, the perfect movie. Every single element of this film is amazing: the sets, the sound design, the soundtrack, the cinematography, the special effects, the acting, the plot, the in-universe mythology; everything comes together to make this film AMAZING and I had to watch it twice to catch everything I had missed before. If everyone in the world had to watch this movie I think our whole society as we know it would change. I can literally not recommend this movie enough, I tell everyone I meet to watch it. I watch it at least once a week, even though I wish I could watch it everyday. This is one of those movies that one can watch endless amounts of times before it even get remotely redundant. Everyone please drop everything and watch this movie right now.

title: Brain Damage Warning
content: If you are planning on cracking open a six pack and chilling out in front of a movie with a loved one or some mates after a hard day at the office then steer well clear of this.*Important:* if you have a partner of friend who punctuates a film with such questions as "Who's that?", "Why are they doing that?" then never watch this with them as I guarantee you will punch them within the first twenty minutes.Be prepared to grapple with string theory, infinite realities, chaos theory and the butterfly effect.Not put off yet? Then you are in for a treat!! This film is a master piece. The subjects are dealt with in an engaging way so they are understandable and thought provoking. The characters have such vitality and are so tangible I feel like I know them. The film is visually beautiful but uses a number of techniques to keep the viewer off balance; Worlds contrast violently, sequences are purposely disjointed, vista shots suddenly become closeups, dreams become reality. But, through the clever uses of visual aids and soundtrack, you can follow the story (even if it feels like you can't at first).I find the film returning when I am stuck in traffic or a wind-borne leaf catches my eye.Make a decision, stop reading and go watch.

title: i've read every other review thus far submitted...
content: and i agree with all of them... the pans and the praises...all. i can understand why some loved its originality and some thought it wholly unoriginal. why some loved the soundtrack and some were put off by it. this movie doesn't allow for a firm foothold, alas. and that's hard for some, going through an intense two hour cinematic/storytelling journey and never feeling like ones feet are touching solid ground. very disorienting. still...i feel like the writer/director hit his mark with every shot he took. and that it is not for those who don't want to work to expand their definition of what good storytelling can be. works of genius are rarely appreciated in their own time. not totally true here, but enough so for me to make these comments... if you make the trip, you may not fully understand where you've been, but you will have no doubt feel as if you've traveled the expanse of time/creation.

title: An amazing story told in a backwards manner.
content: Good story that is fun to follow - 1/2 StarMemorable dialogue - 1/2 StarFeel a pull to watch it a second time - 1 Star (You need to watch this film at least twice to take everything in.)Music/Score stands out - 1 Star (Outstanding music and score!)No noticeable plot holes - 0 StarsStory gets resolved in some way - 0 StarsI personally like the story - 1 StarMemorable likable characters - 1 StarMost things about the story are believable - 1 StarDoesn't get boring - 0 Stars (It is extremely hard to follow at times.)This movie is very touching and the many different stories and lifelines throughout are very prying. But the it's told in a way that will be extremely hard to follow/understand. I believe this will lead many people to not finish it. But it is cast perfectly! Again the story is very non linear but very intriguing at the same time! Worth the watch!

title: An undervalued gem
content: I am a big fan of Christopher Nolan, so no disrespect intended. But if this movie had his name as the director, instead of the relatively unknown Van Dormael, it would have certainly gathered a few Oscars. The narration is bold and unnatural, so pay attention and don't ridicule it from the beginning.. because at the end, everything fits perfectly.Another IMPORTANT note... an understanding of quantum probability wave, Schrodinger cat, and the big bang inflation theory (time reversal when universe expansion stops and contraction begins) are required to completely understand the ending. If you are unaware of these terms, a quick google search should suffice. (These are interesting topics too!)

title: More interesting than The Tree of Life by Malick, but still... and too long
content: I agree that movies should not be primitive, with simple characters and predictable solutions, but over-sophisticated ones are difficult to follow -- especially if you watch them in a cinema without an opportunity to pause and resume. A person's mind can be deceptive and selective, but the director could take into account that all viewers are following the fate of a stranger. However, by the end of the movie, it would be nice to find out what really happened in the hero's life. And less moralization and reasoning, thank you! :) Especially on the issues like mortality, love, devotion, destiny...Jared Leto is really good, the others are just above average. Perhaps their characters have not been distinguished enough. But cameramen, of course, have performed in an excellent way.A must-to-see for those fond of "independent" philosophical movies, for the others - lengthy and boring.

title: Arduous and Intelligent At The Same Time
content: I sat down to Mr. Nobody with the preconceived idea that it would a monotonous, philosophical narrative without much thought or purpose. I was half correct.While the images and artistic techniques displayed in Mr. Nobody are entrancing, they don't quite justify the length of the film. The first and last 15 minutes of the film are arguably the most intelligent portions of the movie, during which the viewer is asked philosophical questions that truly challenge everyday thinking. Sadly, however, the the greater part of the film is dominated by the unnecessary reiteration of these ideas.Indeed, I've never felt both compelled as a viewer yet at the same time utterly bored as I did with Mr. Nobody. At times I was entranced by the imagery and introspective thoughts put forward, but at others I found myself checking my watch and wondering to myself if the movie would ever end.The fundamental problem with this movie is not with its ideas but in its execution. The movie could have been shortened greatly yet supplied the same amount of meaning. Unfortunately, its arduous length and excessive contrasting of choices made by the main character ruined for me what could have been a neater, more polished film.

title: Should be listed as 'Must See"
content: This is a wonderful movie. I am 71 years old. It was very thought provoking. Prompted a lot of life reviewing. I usually only watch a movie once. However, this will be an exception to that. I look forward to seeing it again. There are so many parts I want to revisit to clarify some of the things I couldn't put in order. Had so many questions and I didn't want to spoil the hold this movie had on me by going back. I was looking through Netflix for a movie to watch before fixing dinner. We had a late dinner!! I usually am working on a puzzle or my cross stitch while watching a movie. Not this time. I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I wish I had known about this movie when it was in the theaters. I would love to see it on the big screen with surround sound. This is the kind of movie you can get lost in. I was amazed at how many people were involved in making this film. I was also surprised at the number of locations. I stopped the credits several times to read the details. I really think you should consider a new release here in the states. It should include enough pre reviews with the media so people are aware of how terrific this movie is. Even though it is available to purchase, I would pay to see it in a theater. I pulled it up on the internet to learn more about the making of this film and the story behind it. I haven't gotten that far yet. I'm glad I'm retired because I think this will be a late night! I started reading opinions of others that have watched this. So interesting to read how others interpret the same experiences. Especially a film as complicated as this is. Made the whole experience so much more fun!!! Thanks again for a great evening. Looking forward to researching other films by this cast and crew.

title: 100% worth 2 hours of your life
content: After watching "Mr Nobody", I feel as if my eyes have been opened to the various different aspects and possibilities life can bring. For a film that has the craziest narrative structure I've ever seen, it all makes sense. I believe this film carries a beauty so sublime that not many will understand, and many have already not understood, but give it a chance and it will blow your mind.Jared Leto, for me, played an extremely good role, his ability to show the same character in dozens of different lights was brilliant. I think the only other person as eccentric, bewildering and sombre enough to play this role would have been Johnny Depp, but even then i'm not sure if it would have been as good as Letos.I can tell this is going to be a film that sticks with me for years, and I am thoroughly glad I gave it the time it deserves.

title: Smart, moving and so real
content: I watched this film now in year 2022 - 13 years after its release. Before watching I hadn't read any reviews and did not have any hopes - "just another Sci Fi".This turned out to be the best film I'd ever seen in my entire life. The plot is just brilliant, and let me tell you, it was definitely not an easy task creating this masterpiece. Movie is smart and does not get boring at any point - for people who are afraid of a 2.5 hour movie - do not be, it draws you in.It is incredibly moving and insightful, also gave me crazy goosebumps at the end.Strongly recommended watch, however definitely one of these movies which requires your attention!

title: Wow!
content: Having lived a life of expat for the last 3 years in Africa and Iraq, movies haven't been my number one priority. Obviously I know about big blockbusters when they come out, and I see the occasional movie on OSN or even on the laptop, but I never heard about this one until I stumbled into it yesterday. Tired of Hollywood junk, I was looking on IMDb for a more complex film and this one seemed for some reason good. Good is shrimps and lobster, this is just excellent. This is not entertainment like Hollywood blockbusters, this is a complex and mind blowing picture that may be at times hard to catch up, but extremely well directed, a fantastic script and good performances by the actors. There's no Oscar wining performance here just because the actors are not the leading role, the story and the direction are. Very few films ever achieve this level of depth. I wouldn't miss it for the world.

title: About choice
content: I haven't viewed this film yet, but it intrigued me enough to purchase it, arriving in the next two weeks. From those reviewing it, one important story element is our ability to choose, and the consequences of our choices.From my experience, part of the human process is first desire, second fear, third control, and they become mixed up. Before seeing this film, reviews do not speak of existentialism, perhaps the philosophy most relevant to this story. So I give you the following regarding choice and existentialism, with a grain of salt, so to speak, for it is about philosophy, which is only a mirror and not perhaps to your personal taste."Perhaps the most prominent theme in existentialist writing is that of choice. Humanity's primary distinction, in the view of most existentialists, is the freedom to choose. Existentialists have held that human beings do not have a fixed nature, or essence, as other animals and plants do; each human being makes choices that create his or her own nature. In the formulation of the 20th-century French philosopher Jean Paul Sartre, existence precedes essence. Choice is therefore central to human existence, and it is inescapable; even the refusal to choose is a choice. Freedom of choice entails commitment and responsibility. Because individuals are free to choose their own path, existentialists have argued, they must accept the risk and responsibility of following their commitment wherever it leads. --Encarta Encyclopedia" Why am I writing about a film before I've seen it? It's in this film. Catch 22. So watch it.Greg McCormick Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

title: A nice sci fi advetrue.
content: It reminded me of the butterfly effect but this movie was a bit obscure. I liked the overall script but the story does get offtrack at some point.

title: we create our own reality......
content: The film Mr.Nobody was very confusing in the beginning, skipping from one frame to another, one possibility of reality to another and you don't really see what's happening. However it is all done very beautifully and elegant. It focuses on this boy torn between his parents and has to make an important decision, go with his mother, or stay with his father.There was no set storyline as it is kind of the point, but a very powerful message that the film on a whole does manage to send is the repercussions of any decision. As you watch this film you sort of watch all of his decisions play out and what different versions of life he could have as a result of his decision at any given moment at any given time in his life. However I feel that this side is only just scratching the surface off what the true meaning is behind this film and there is in fact more depth to it than the importance of making decisions.However behind just the importance of decision making there is an idea presented by the film that these alterations and versions of his life is all as real as the other. It isn't necessarily how decision making can be very problematic but more of how all of the alternations already exist. When we see Nemo as an old man looking back at his life he remembers all of the different alterations and not just one set path, he even had the ability to talk to his younger self and alter his course of life. Nemo could affect what happens and will things to happen and that is a very important thing to think about.So what exactly does that mean, well I think it tears down what we see as time and space completely. Time is not a constant forward moving motion and what has happened can be reverted.There is not one moment but instead infinite moments in time which are happening at the same time with infinite possibilities. What is even more interesting is that we control that, we can decide for what we want and we don't live by the will of destiny or something. Not at all, but instead we will those things and happenings into existence, whether it's the fortunate moments or the misfortunes. Just as Nemo had the ability to change the course of his life, we too could create our own reality.

title: His So-Called Lives
content: Do you look at all the possible choices before you, and figure they all have some appeal, but ultimately fatal flaws? Me too, and so I often cannot pass on streaming a video from Netflix and look for a book instead. There's something about the physical DVD's just showing up and then you have a commitment to spend your short life together (well, its short life aka running time.) When you stream you can so easily jump to another entirely different feature.So it was I chose to stream this movie. And I mostly stuck with it, for its visual lure. There's enough art direction to keep one's eyes fixed, and the story itself shuffles between alternate stream/dream/universes in the main character Nemo's life.But less is spent on any sci-fi angle, rather it allows triple the romance. Even more so, as some streams have their own branched rivulets in them.Thinking too much about the film deflates it I feel. Is Nemo == omen backwards or does it tie to a recurring death-by-water tarot card of sorts that pops up in the alterna-universes.Leto is good again, and helps carry the soul of the film. He's prettier than his three leading ladies. The too easily dismissed model minority model, the wounded bird that wounds others and then the love of his life, who pushes a modern taboo for blended families with benefits.Eminently watchable but ultimately ephemeral. Like our own lives? Well the voodoo Maori-esque hypnotist might have snuck into my subconscious. Nice work by Allan Corduner.I did find myself wondering if the writer/director wanted to set up something more contrasting immortality versus mortality, where the decisions to lead one to one's demise, but they do nonetheless lead one. He's named Mr. Nobody, but a world full of everlasting nobodies tunes in for this life story.Anyways, not as rewardingly twisted as "Donnie Darko" was for alienated adolescents of all ages, but time better spent than looking for old flames on Facebook, surely.

title: Loved It
content: I finally had the opportunity to watch this incredible film where Jared Leto, once again, amazed me with his great acting abilities. Though I'm not usually one for the sci-fi genre, this movie was different in that it was exciting, sad, romantic, and REAL. The word "real" is very relative, but I feel it's appropriate here: Every individual character had a purpose, no matter how much they actually showed up in the movie. Leto's character development was absolutely beautiful and, as usual, his emotional connection was spot-on. The artistic aspect—both in the script and scene editing—is phenomenal as well. I would suggest this to people who like strange and inspirational plot lines with many unexpected twists and turns. To sum it up, it was great.

title: Confusing, but good.
content: A very detailed and distinguished view of choice. Like the butterfly effect on acid but not as depressing. I personally like Jared Leto as an actor (mostly), and feel he did good as the title character. This one will make you think. For a little while at least.

title: Do not waste your time
content: We can safely say that you either hate this film or love it. The second category of people (lovers)are the ones who like to think that the more complicated is the movie the better and they pride their selves for pretending to understand it easily. That is not the case with this film at all. Simply put; the story line is all over the place,trying to be clever and that makes it an awful watch.I have to say a lot of afford was put in for the production of this movie and the spacial effects are quite impressive but it fails in many other areas, especially in the plot as it has many loose ends.I would not like to waste any more of my time with this film by going into flaws of this movie individually as it would take pages of typing.If you have 2.5 hours to waste be my guest.

title: Mr. Nobody, Welcome in my top 20
content: Past, present, future. The butterfly effect, the power of decision, the various existing dimensions. Love, life, death, space, slumber, fear, water, fire...this movies covered so many highly interesting subject with amazing fashion. The length of 2h30min was justified as there is a tremendous amount of sights and emotions to absorb in this masterpiece. Many aspects of this movie were mind-blowing, the story was unique, the cinematography was top notch and the acting was great. Good choice of music all the way too. The final scene left me with shivers and a huge smile on my face. Just like my favourite movie, Requiem For a Dream, I'll have the most people watch this as possible and I, myself, can't wait to revisit this gem. 10/10 (oh and BTW, by watching the Making of , one can witness the unbelievable effort that was put in many of the scenes. That increase the value for sure. )

title: Like an advert for  life assurance
content: The style of photography, the close shots, the angles and the contrast are an early sign that the sensibility here is very close to advertising. At first the hyper real proximity of the image is interesting; as if, in Umberto Eco's view the perception of reality may reveal something beneath; but as the movie moves on and the rupture in the narrative becomes more glaring it is obvious that this is very bad writing and has no real sense of narrative logic or how to combine it with characterization.This film is all surface: the light, the glow and contrast of images and how lovely they look, like a fetishistic advertising campaign.The simpleness of the construction and the poverty of its ideas are present within the first act and therefore what ensues is not much more than the lame resolution of the basic premise. It has the smug contented appearance of an adverting campaign, as if all the focus group research confirmed that that what was shown has been preapproved.Play this movie at double speed on a DVD player and it is still perfectly comprehensible because there is absolutely no depth to the writing - it is all superficially obvious from the pictures.

title: I think somebody just made the movie of my life...
content: Gawd, this film left me sideways for 2 days after watching. It is just accessible enough to grasp, but still leaves you asking questions. If you like "Eternal Sunshine..." you'll love this film. Is it art house? A bit... it makes you work to keep up with it, but combines both beautiful cinematography with a GREAT story. Every detail is thought out, the magic just keeps on weaving away in front of your eyes. You probably know the storyline, so I won't repeat it, you can read the IMDb synopsis. It really drives home the magic of life, which is that although we have choices in our lives, and these will radically alter our course, there is still the wild card of randomness and chaos that can alter these choices. I'm sure the other 3 of myself in different dimensions also have written positive reviews about this...

title: How to Rewrite a Previous Plot.
content: Mr. Nobody is nothing special though Jared Keto does an excellent imitation of acting. Moreso the director, name also unimportant, does an excellent job of pretending to be a Director. Why?First off this movie immediately reminded me of one of the best movies ever and on my top list for Western fiction based on real history. That is Little Big Man starring Dustin Hoffman. Looking at Jared's old man is exactly the same as looking at Dustin's old man. All the liver spots, wrinkles, etc are the same. I'm pretty sure Mr. Nobody's director said, Make Jared look like Dustin. So no real imagination or work done there.More importantly while I like some of the concepts of dimensions and personally have espoused them for forty years now, I'm beginning to see them emerge into the debates and Ted Talk forums as interesting talking points. Unfortunately they are presented in this movie with all the elegance of a dancing pig. They are unconvincing ideas in Mr. Nobody because as a Hollywood movie they are mixed with all the entertainment trends that sell silly movies to the peons and uneducated masses. It's like throwing mud into a fine Swiss watch as Churchill said once. A real blended mess of confusion and ruining what could have been a more engrossing film built on these ideas from a more original and logical story line. From Forgotten Planet to Star trek to 2001: A Space Odyssey no stone was left unabused in this mess.If you wonder why I gave it six stars unlike the average reviews it's because if you're young and really don't know science fiction then you think this is good stuff. That is ignorance. If your up on scifi history, physics, philosophy and cultures of the past then you know I'm being overly generous with my rating of six.

title: An underrated, if a tad bit overlong science fiction movie
content: Mr. Nobody is a strange movie. And I mean that in a complimentary way. It is a bizarre piece of science fiction involving mental illness, time travel and the concept of life and death. What makes it even more spectacular is that is it stunning to look at- seriously one of the most beautiful films I have ever seen. Jared leto has a knack of picking offbeat scripts and he s bang on the money in choosing this one. What can I say...I think you should give this film a choice but beware that it is a bit heavy handed and clocking in at 2 and a half hours quite long to boot. However, for those who enjoy an offbeat tale this is a great 2 and a half hours of escapism into a fantasy land.

title: Fiction sprinkled with incorrect use of scientific concepts  is NOT science fiction
content: I am getting sick and tired of authors and screenwriters writing fiction and adding some misunderstood scientific terms and calling it science fiction.Mr Nobody is epitome of such nonsense wrapped up in some philosophical BS which caters to one of the basic human feelings - regret.Mr Nobody takes the basic ingredient of regret and sprinkles the concepts of parallel lives/universe, time, dimensions etc with reckless abandon to spice it up.Science fiction - I don't think so. Bad Fiction - Perhaps. Nonsense - absolutely

title: Great Mysterious Movie
content: This is one of the best mysterious movies that I have seen. One boring night I was searching in my movies archive I randomly played this movie and when I saw the idea I attracted to that and my sleepiness gone away. Its about choices and their effect on our life that how can a simple choice deeply affect our life. The stories change in the best time that you may think the last story was a dream or thought or even a book. You can see how divorce will impress kids. Also it contains a scientific theory about big bang, world entropy and growing world size that improve the story. At the end it gives you one of the best movies end. 10/10

title: Enjoy the journey and it will cleanse your soul
content: Halfway through the movie and came to realize it is one of the rare movies that the end result doesn't really affect anything but you simply enjoy the journey. *edit* End of the movie. A very surreal movie with such a deep but simple message. A message fortunately I haven't wronged. I give this movie a 10/10 such a cleansing experience. Leave it to the French to create a masterpiece out of convoluted pieces. I cannot recommend it strongly enough. But beware not all can enjoy this movie as much as I did as you have to be able to keep track and discern the different timelines very fast. It's been a very long time, since Pan's Labyrinth, for a movie to touch me so profoundly. It will make you smile, it will make you sad and it will make you shed tears for both reasons. 10/10 This is a classic piece of art.

title: Imagine if Cloud Atlas was good...
content: That's pretty much what this is like. Visually compelling and mind-bending. It runs a bit long but, still, a worthwhile watch. Asks big questions and proposes big answers. Many ambitious movies of this type bore me. I generally find them vague and heavy-handed. I feel that this one actually delivers and lives up to it's promise. If you're a fan of surrealistic pictures, you should enjoy this. Recommended. Instead of watching bloated, Hollywood blockbusters, give this one a try. A touching, human and unflinching piece. I wish there were more pictures like this around. That's all. Thank you for reading. Peace in the middle east. Namaste.

title: Thoughts about Mr. Nobody
content: Choosing to see this movie was sheer chance, I just came across it and decided to give it a shot - the movie turns out to be one of the best if not the best movie I've seenMr. nobody is an incredible movie that everyone should watch, the complexity of it may baffle you at first but when you begin to understand it the movie gets better and better to near perfection. the filming angels, the soundtrack, the casting and the directing are absolutely perfect and I may even say it was Jared Let's best performance so farnow go ahead and watch it, you won't regret!

title: This movie can not be explained but must be watched entirely.
content: The movie has a slow start and will confuse you like a Quentin Tarantino movie. Stick with it till the end and you will be left with lots to think about and reflect on. The story is about a nine year old boy who finds it near impossible to decide between his divorcing parents. Does he go with his mother or his father? The boy has the ability to remember the future. He sees what his life would be like if he chooses his father and he sees what his life would be like if he chooses his mother. He sees many varying futures in both paths. The story follows his romance with three different girls. The story is rich with deep thought and explores many different scientific theories.

title: The only 'Intelligent' sci-fi ever made
content: I am so fed so fed up of seeing psuedo intellectual films rated 8+ on Imdb. The fan accounts of Nolan and Aronofsky rate each of their film a perfect ten even before watching it. For this, there are too many of such films on Imdb top 250. These people have ruined Imdb. While gems like this, which is masterpiece by all means is rated at an ordinary 7.8.This film is all about exploring posibilities. And does it succesfully. It touches so many subjects without being preachy, it's almost unbelievable. First one hour may feel a little slow and unmoving, after that it's so enjoyable to watch. It's not about if the ending makes sense or not as the purpose is served before that. There are some questions unanswered, but it actually doesn't matter.There are films like The man from earth made with similar intentions. But unlike that one , Mr. Nobody tells the story visually rather than purely by talking.I can't explain the story here, but can only advice to watch it as well. It's unlike anything you have seen before.

title: Rated it 7 for the effort. The effort is plenty and only slightly misplaced.
content: I came across this film in quite a few lists and decided to give it a try.The film is beautifully shot with every frame, set, location and art used to its best.The casting is good with everyone doing their best and exactly what is required of them.The film deals with the alternative paths in life that we often ponder about and tries to strike a balance with the fantasy, surrealism, mystery, suspense, larger than life approach and movie magic. But....in my opinion if falls short trying to achieve too much. In other words it is over ambitious.It has plenty of good things to talk about too. The background music is excellent, the plot holds your attention till the very end, the characterization of all the versions of all the people is quite believable.It is a good movie to watch if you begin with low expectation.....in which case you will actually be impressed by how well made and beautifully shot this movie is!!!!Happy viewing :-)

title: will time run backwards once the universe collapses?
content: this movie kept me magnetized over it's entire length - almost 2 and a half hours. it kept me amazed, smiling, frightened, wondering and curious. and it left me puzzled and satisfied at the same time. the plot's underlying idea is a rather straight forward one, the storyline(s) interestingly entangled, and the whole story in itself coherent. what amazed me so much about this movie is its structure and powerful dramaturgy, continuously leaving us with open questions, but never failing to eventually answer and explain in a later scene (while every now and then we are distracted by dream-like sequences). however, we are left in the dark about the most important and obvious question throughout the entire movie (- will we get an answer in the end?). the filming and overall visual impression are exquisite, and so is the acting. don't miss this trip!

title: Jared Leto banging his way through time and space
content: Basically this is about Jared boinking his way across parallel universes spanning the entirety of time and spaceOverall, it's an entertaining film. Parent alert - a lot of nipple action.

content: This is the one of the most fabulous movie in my life. Incredible perfect. It deserves highest rating. Fiction and scenes have been done meaningful. It is a love story but at the same time it is a sci-fiction movie. Musics were chosen very careful. The choices and butterfly effect fulfill each other. title: A Philosophical Journey Through Life: The Deep and Inspiring Reflection of 'Mr. Nobody' and Schopenhauer's philosophy
content: The film "Mr. Nobody" (2009) is a masterpiece of cinema that addresses the philosophy of existence in a profound and inspiring way. Directed by Jaco Van Dormael, the feature tells the story of Nemo Nobody, a 118-year-old man who lives in a dystopian future and is the last mortal in a world where immortality is common.The film brings elements that directly refer to Schopenhauer's philosophy, especially with regard to the questioning of life and death, the transience of existence, and the illusion of individuality. The plot, which unfolds in different timelines, offers a unique perspective on life and its choices, and how they affect the trajectory of each individual.Just like Schopenhauer, who claimed that life is a constant search for satisfaction and that pain is inevitable, "Mr. Nobody" also exposes pain and suffering as an inevitable part of the human condition. However, the film also presents the beauty of life and the importance of living fully, even in the face of the unknown and the inevitable.Watching this film is a unique and transformative experience, which will certainly awaken your curiosity for Schopenhauer's philosophy and reflection on life and death. "Mr. Nobody" is an invitation to rethink our choices and values, and to appreciate every moment of life, even the most painful ones. I strongly recommend this film to everyone who wants a deep and inspiring reflection on human existence.

title: Choices and consequences
content: Every choice has a consequence and No consequence has a redo,but this movie dwells on what if? This movie perfectly captures the whole life of a person imagined by a 9 year old of what the consequences can be by a person's decisions and counter decisions like a move of a pawn in a chess.Jared's acting through the movie was top notch, with supporting characters having their own part to play, i could say this movie cannot be shown better. I would strongly recommend this to audience who are looking for something different that provokes deep thought.Though this did not achieve much on gross domestically, as it was from a french director, i can certainly say this will be one of those movies that will remain in your thoughts for a while.Not just movies like Inception, Interstellar which are highly commercialized during the release but there are movies like this, The man from earth, wild things etc.. that really deserves huge attention and are worth watching.

title: Nobody
content: I didn't find out about this film from the top 50 best films, I didn't see it on TV, I didn't know it was at the box office, only by chance I found a post on the forum: "Watch the movie "Mr. Nobody"." This is not a movie epic, not a legend, this is a film that makes you think. They learn about it only from good friends or by chance on forums.Get ready for the fact that for the first hour you will not delve into the idea of the film, it will seem to you like an elastic band that has lost its taste and you will think that you have been watching it for quite a long time. But this does not mean that it needs to be turned off, no, force yourself to sit in front of the screen a little more and then the "gum" will taste.Have you often thought about the choice that will change your life? Should I stay with my father or run away after the train? Admit that you can't swim or call me a fool? This choice will change your life, but you will remain yourself. There is no right choice. Any choice leads to death, to the end of decision-making.

title: Ambitious but Overly Convoluted: A Missed Opportunity for Depth
content: While Mr. Nobody is often praised for its ambitious narrative and philosophical depth, I believe its 7.7 IMDb rating is somewhat inflated. In my opinion, the film aligns more with a 6.7 rating at best.The references to quantum physics and the exploration of alternate realities are intriguing in theory, but the execution feels overly detached from any relatable sense of realism. Some plot elements stretch beyond suspension of disbelief, venturing into territory that feels unnecessarily convoluted rather than thought-provoking.Midway through, the film loses its grip on coherence, making it difficult to stay engaged. The non-linear structure, while intended to be intellectually stimulating, instead comes off as disjointed and chaotic. Even by the end, piecing everything together feels more like a chore than a rewarding cinematic experience.While I appreciate the film's ambition, the complexity seems forced, sacrificing emotional connection for the sake of being enigmatic.

title: Thought provoking
content: "Every path is the right path. Everything could've been anything else. And it would have just as much meaning."Mr. Nobody is a movie which shows the multiple possibilities a young boy's life could turn out when he is faced with a choice at a critical moment in his life.The movie shows different timelines/possibilities where the life of the boy could head to depending on certain choices, all with their ups and downs. Some were more joyous than others, some more depressing, some more heartfelt etc. While it is impossible to show all the possibilities, the movie did it best to show as much as possible in the time frame it had without getting too crammed up or rushed.Jared Leto plays the lead and gives a great performance, not surprisingly. And the accompanying cast also gives an almost universal good performance.The movie does have this 'Inception confusion' effect where different stuff happening at different times could confuse the viewer and in addition to that, the movie has this thick layer of coat containing philosophical questions, science theories etc that one could delve deep into searching for more meaning or whatever, but in the end, the core of the movie is rather simple.This movie really gripped me from the start and it didn't felt nearly as long as its 2 and half hour run-time. The cinematography was pretty nice and some illustrations, like the future world shown, was great.A great watch which I would definitely recommend.8.3/10

title: Intriguing and enigmatic film
content: After watching Mr Nobody I can't say I fully understand what I watched or what really happened. But it was a visually attractive film and perhaps a decent puzzle for those who want to figure it out.Jared Leto plays a creaky old man and several young versions of himself in different lives with different women. Each life has its emotional pull with some being more believable than others.Recommended film but be prepared to scratch your head towards the end as new sci fi elements are introduced.

title: What a ride!
content: Wow, this movie kept me at the edge of the seat the entire 141 minutes. It's been a while since I wrote a review here, but this movie really deserves it.First I have to admit that I'm a fan of original movies which explores philosophical and psychological dilemmas/issues (Cube, Donnie Darko, Memento, Matrix to name a few). This movie really takes it a notch further with it's constant switching between numerous alternative chain of events so that you never know what to expect next. But the cutting is always done with finesse so somehow the scenes always fits together in a logical (or emotional) way (which may not be apparent until after wards). The cinematography is beautiful and really helps strengthen the story telling. The acting is top notch, especially Jared is great.I won't spoil to much of the story, but I recommend that you see this movie with an open mind, and don't try to make sense of everything that happens. After a while the pieces will start to fall into place (although I admit I don't fully grasp everything after the first viewing). If you can do that, you're in for a hell of a ride!

title: A travel through time and choices
content: This movie was really well shot. The scenarios are incredible, and for those who like a confusing atmosphere - you can see what I'm talking about by the number of different actors for the same character - that gets elaborated and explained with time, this is a great movie. It's similar to The Butterfly Effect, Donnie Darko and perhaps Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, because of the romance. Some compared it to Click too, which I don't think is a good comparison because this isn't a comedy.I thought the movie was too long, though. I was kind of impatient at the mark of 90min and it kept running to the mark of 141min. I didn't like the music and some scenes of this movie, but those are details. It's a good movie, but I don't think I'd have the patience to watch it again.

title: Nonsense
content: Tries to be so many things and ends up failing on them all.

title: Science Fiction Meets Real Intuition
content: I rarely rate movies 10/10, and I could expound upon this movie for hours, but I'm going to keep it short and sweet. This movie looks at the principle of choice and its effect on the human condition and in particular, a specific human life. This is one of those movies which is better suited to just pressing play and being astounded by the journey (as opposed to researching, watching trailers, etc.). The acting, cinematography, writing, directing, and story/writing here are absolutely excellent - this is a movie which will stick with you for a long time - and if it doesn't, you probably weren't paying attention. This is a gem and I highly recommend you watch it - or re-watch it - NOW.

content: Mr NOBODY.....What will happen if I have never written this review and you have not read it? and then probably you have not decided to see this film and have not gone to a video shop or a CD parlor or a website to download this movie and in the mean time you came across a comment that caught your attraction and the meantime he or she is online and you met him and that changed your life for ever? title: Worth watching and instructive.
content: The style of the movie is actually very good because it is mixed and interesting, especially if you stick with it to the end. It simulates, at times, the great movie, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, though very different. My only problem with the movie, Mr Nobody, is the sex, but I was able to fast forward over several sex scenes while watching on Netflix.What makes this movie worth watching and instructive is that it shows, nearly perfectly, what the life of a God-less person can be for many.Hope, love,fear, joy...are they all molecular? Are we merely atoms?Yes, some think so.Awesome and sad at the same time. A great movie.

title: Outstanding and thought-provoking
content: Outstanding film, thought-provoking and full of details. Ideal for the sensitive, for the ones who seek possibilities but mostly believe in fate. The plot is complex yet totally understandable. The soundtrack is superb and leaves nothing to chance. Several ingredients are condensed in this genius movie: realism, science fiction, romance, drama. The film is visually incredible since every little detail seems to have been taken care of, not to mention the strong performance the cast puts on. I think the plot deals with extremely personal issues and at the same time, anyone can relate. Maybe adults could enjoy and appreciate the movie better because they have gone through more stages in life and made more choices. Totally worth watching more than once. Don't miss it. If you dislike deep masterpieces, don't even bother.

title: It grew on me
content: If I had reviewed this film soon after I watched it - I would have rated it a 5 or 6. It was disjointed - and I thought the dabbling with physics and thermodynamics was "college kid stuff". But for the next couple of days I kept thinking about how little decisions and events had affected the course of my life. I am in my 70's - so the course is long and winding - with many possible side-roads. I don't know if this was what the film was trying to say - but that's what it said to me. So I gave it a 7 - maybe next week it would get an 8 - we will see.

title: Genius
content: A film that makes you think. A film you wont forget for a long time. this film is spectacular in so many aspects, right from the plot to the screenplay to the casting and the music. if you are looking for a major fantasy or sci-fi plot, you will be disappointed. The fantasy genre acts only as a catalyst for this romance, drama movie.Its a shame that this movie wasn't nominated for any Oscar award. This movie will show how great of an actor Jared Leto is. Its unbelievable how well he plays all the versions of the character with such little screen time for each of them. the rest of the caste too were phenomenal. the film includes everything one could ask for: humour, touching,surreal, thrill...As every film,this too has some flaws, but they can easily be overlooked due to the uniqueness of the film. You will surely not regret watching it.

title: Beautiful but boring
content: The past. Not an entity where variation tends to exist. What's done is done, right? Mr. Nobody, a film by Jaco Van Dormael explores and re-imagines the theory of the Arrow of Time: the notion that time moves in only one direction.A simplistic sketch of the film's plot: By 2092 the world has moved on. 118 year-old Nemo Nobody, the last remnant of the old world recounts his life to a reporter. Nemo's details his past as a series of fragments. He recount them as if he were in fact choosing his past the way we choice our future. We are shown array of lives."Why does the smoke never go back into the cigarette? Why do the molecules spread away from each other? Why does a spilled drop of ink never reform?" As the laws of entropy take the universe further and further into a state of disarray what will happen when we hit maximum entropy? When total chaos bestills nothingness? Mr. Nobody is not exactly hot off the reels. It's a 2009 film that was on my must watch list. Despite so many awesome elements, the cinematic culmination of Mr. Nobody was rather disappointing. Mostly, the scenes tended to drag on. This was 100 minutes worth of great material stretched over the course of 155 minutes. Van Dormael should have taken a cue from his own philosophy and realize that if the Arrow moves only forward, and if I'm going to spend 155 minutes of my Arrow watching your film, I'd better be good.More film reviews at getthebonesaw.blogspot.com

title: Listen. Nemo Nobody had become unstuck in time.
content:
I've seen the title of this film on so many "Best of . . ." lists I had to give it watch as soon as I ran across it. I was a bit dubious when during the opening credits it kept going on and on about how the film was a pan-European production. Was I facing two hours of subtitles? Fortunately, no. It was King's English throughout. I've never seen so many beautiful big-eyed human beings together in one place. The story was good, the filming was intriguing, dare I say surrealistic? No, I won't because the point of the film is that all choices in life are the correct ones. No matter what reality we experience, if reality it is, it is the correct reality and we, every nan jack of us, are playing our part in the right way at the right time. Even so, it doesn't mean our time on stage will be fun. there is love and the heartbreak caused by same; the is life; there is disappointment; there is tragedy and madness and death. The film contained contained the themes that make life worth living unless the life is TOO good; then it's just a bore. I want my. last words to be, "Today is the happiest day of my life!" I hope I remember it at the right time and don't take too long to say it AND that there is some there to hear it. Is an uttered wisdom wise if there is no one to hear it?
I recommend Mr. Nobody even though I gave it a C+, six stars, because after two or three hours into the film I was ready for it to wrap things up but realized it was only half done.
This film is Billy Pilgrim meets Forrest Gump but that's not a bad thing as long as the director kept showing me interesting things and messing with my head. He got out of the groove an hour or so into the film but I was rooting for him to find it again and he did.
Nemo Nobody had a far better adolescence than I did. Good for him. The girls liked him and his terror of them was manageable, barely an inconvenience. I recommend Mr. Nobody to anyone with a bright mind willing to endure a bit of confusion to answer the question: What will happen next and is it really happening?

title: In a nutshell
content: This movie is about life's choices. Or maybe it is about a senile old man who can't remember his life. No wait, it's about dropping LSD and having a bad trip that you just want to end! In any case as far as entertainment value of a movie, I give it 5 stars.

title: Flawed near-masterpiece box office dud
content: Beautifully directed, photographed, edited, and, mostly acted, "Mr. Nobody" is testimony to how even the best films prospects can be destroyed by horrendous marketing. While "Mr. Nobody" may be an accurate title, it is a horrible title for a movie of such scope and accomplishment. Perhaps the horrid title is why only a few US theaters played this movie, returning only a few thousand dollars on a film which cost $47M. Fortunately, streaming video makes it possible to see this flawed near-masterpiece. In fact, I saw the theatrical version as part of the Netflix streaming package; and the director's cut, which addresses all but one of what I consider "flaws" is available on Amazon streaming. My only criticism of both versions is the casting of Diane Kruger as the adult "Anna". Juno Temple, an adult actress who plays juvenile roles, is, again, world class, with the intensity needed for the pivotal "Anna". On the other hand, Diane Kruger, lacks both Ms. Temple's intensity and disproportionately large breasts, which makes it pretty hard to believe she is the same character. Better that Temple be aged with makeup or digitally. Nonetheless, "Mr. Nobody" emerges as one my Top 20 all-time favorite films. I give "Mr. Nobody" a "9".

title: Imaginative and Engaging
content: Mr. Nobody is the type of movie that sticks with you for a bit after watching it, and a number of factors go into that. Jared Leto's stellar performance, the unique (and at times confusing) premise, and the stories told throughout are just some of the highlights.The film opens in the year 2092, as 118 year old Nemo Nobody is the last living mortal on earth. As he nears death, he is asked to recall his life, and what follows is a jumbled recollection of seemingly contradicting accounts of what may or may not have happened in his life, focusing largely on Nemo at ages 9, 15, and 34. At first, the contradictions can be extremely confusing to the viewers (as well as those interviewing 118 year old Nemo), but before long you learn to accept it as a part of the movie's commentary on the impact the choices we make can have on our lives, and by the end of the movie, one can make sense of the contradictions.Ultimately, Mr. Nobody is anchored by outstanding performances by Jared Leto, Toby Regbo, and Juno Temple, while the rest of the cast contributes performances that range from good to great. Clocking in at a little under two and a half hours, this film demands your attention with multiple gripping story lines involving drama, romance, coming of age themes, and some subtle science fiction. I would not recommend this movie to those who need to understand exactly what is going on at every point in a movie, but I would highly recommend it to everybody else (keeping the R rating in mind), especially those who enjoy a good mind bender.

title: Billed as a sci-fi but existentialist to the core
content: After watching "Mr Nobody", I was in a bit of a daze. The story is complex to say the least but the characters and the ideas (of which there are many) kept me intrigued. By the end I was left with compelling and contradictory ideas that left me perplexed but I can honestly say it was worth every minute and for this simple reason ..at its core "Mr Nobody" is about love and the almost impossible choices that we have to make. It is existentialist to its core and touches on string theory, quantum theory, (but in an easy to understand way) and the consequences of the choices we make. And yet after thinking on the movie as a whole, it is about intense pain ..being torn between two loves and having to choose. As a movie, the directing is very very good, the acting very good and the cinematography is excellent. I'd highly recommend it.

title: One of the best films ever!
content: Recently I have watched the movie Mr. Nobody, and probably never had so many feelings and emotions after watching films. In his interview he tells the story of his life, well three its variants. On the question which of them was the right one he says "Every path is the right path". The film made me think about many things, especially how strong a little thing can change the entire life, and how often we have to make choices. But "As long as you don't choose, everything remains possible". The movie might seem to be unclear and strange, but this makes the film so great. title: Excellent film, great mix of apt filmmaking, artistic vision and metaphysics

Boy, was I wrong! And so glad I was. 20 minutes into it, having watched the early life sequence, I was fully submerged. It wasn't just the story - the set, colors, music, camera, scene pacing - all came together beautifully to convey the deep philosophical and artistic vision of the director. This is undoubtedly the "director's film". It is one of those films, which is hard, if not impossible to retell, and once watched, makes the viewer to watch it again, and again, enjoying every single scene. I've never been a big fan of this actor, and maybe unjustly so, but his youthful innocence sprayed all over the screen really doesn't fit the story well. This is a minor bump though.

content: A very incoherent and unusual experience. Unfortunately interesting visuals and cinematography doesn't make up for a movie which doesn't hold our interest as this was one of the most boring experiences I ever had. I tried my best to focus on the weird events and connect with the characters but this just doesn't happen. There are multiple time lines and life possibilities for the main character which are individually not that interesting. As soon as you somehow get track of what's happening in one time line the director just throws you in another meaningless direction which follows the main character until his death. At the end the message I got was "Our life is the sum of the choices we make". There is no problem with the message but the way we got there is totally unappealing. It may also discuss philosophical ideas such as "What would you make if you knew the outcome of a certain action?" but in the end it's just not worth the journey. The big bang and crunch were for me the most interesting aspects of the movie but they didn't seem to correlate to the main character in any way other than that he knew when the big crunch was going to happen. Strangely enough "It will bring order in our messed up ever-expanding life!". I would rather have these theories examined from a religious point of view. As a consequence of our choices and actions we will be then judged and either rewarded or punished without relating to any religion in particular. In conclusion, the movie had a lot of potential in its basic premise, visuals and cinematography but wasted it all mainly on a boring unfocused love story and mixing elements which does not correlate to each other in any meaningful way.

title: Definitely worth watching
content: This movie might not be perfect, but it is intellectually stimulating, visually stunning, moving and incredibly rich.In fact, that might be its main problem: there are enough ideas in this movie to make two or three. But if you enjoy complexity, this is a movie you should watch.It is difficult to summarize it. To start with, it is a movie on chance (the famous "butterfly effect"), on the impact of decisions on our lives (the old "what if?" idea, say, à la Sliding doors, but taken to an entirely different level of complexity), on the fascinating idea that there might be persons, events, which are bound to form part of our lives whichever choices we make, and on the tension between the fear, and the beauty, of not knowing what's coming next. Linked to all this is the fear of making decisions, any decision, since they rule out certain possibilities forever. Is it preferable not to chose (and ultimately, not live) or are all possible lives equally "right"?It is an extremely complex work. The sub-plots multiply and there comes an intriguing challenge – is there one logical explanation for all, or are there elements of deliberate irrationality? I am inclined towards for the first option but I might need to watch it a third time (at least) to come to a conclusion.The images are beautiful. The colors are rich, there is plenty of symbolism and small details which might escape the first time one watches it. The camera dives into the protagonists' eyes with a quasi-hypnotic effect, the depth and emotions that they convey are rarely seen in movies.I should mention the cast, overall very convincing. The actors who portray the characters at different ages have been exquisitely chosen. Again, it's the eyes – you can really recognize the young Anna in the older one. And the same goes for Nemo. My highest praise goes to Toby Regbo and Juno Temple, and the way the director has shot their teenagers' love scene. I had never seen a movie depicting in such a vivid and loving way the marvel of love at that age. I am still in awe. Sarah Polley was also excellent in portraying the character of a depressive woman (or most probably she's affected by bipolar disorder). She was so convincing that at times she made me shiver.This is a movie that will make you think for a while. It might all sound very "heavy" but you will leave the cinema with a smile on your face. I really recommend watching it.

title: Not really an original, is it?
content: This movie borrows heavily from a myriad of other films... a boy can predict cataclysmic events... life progression changes depending whether a hero makes a train or not (remember "Sliding Doors"?)...
